summary: This is an email chain from December 2019 between federal prosecutors and attorney Robert Glassman, who represents a client (a victim/witness) in the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss logistical planning for an in-person meeting with the client, and the prosecutors seek permission to contact potential witnesses identified by the client, including her mother.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney representing a client (a victim/witness) in the SDNY investigation into Epstein and Maxwell. He is coordinating a meeting between his client and federal prosecutors.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: A federal prosecutor with the SDNY, copied on emails discussing investigation logistics and witness contact.

persons.name: Howie Simon
persons.context: Identified by the client as a contact the prosecutors wish to reach out to as part of their investigation.

persons.name: Dr. Cabe
persons.context: Identified by the client as a contact the prosecutors wish to reach out to as part of their investigation.

persons.context: Identified by the client as a contact the prosecutors wish to reach out to as part of their investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as a subject of the SDNY investigation, with prosecutors intending to discuss his specific conduct with the witness.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as a subject of the SDNY investigation, with prosecutors intending to discuss her specific conduct with the witness.

connections.description: Attorney-prosecutor correspondence regarding the coordination of a witness interview and investigation steps.
Glassman's client is a witness/victim in the investigation into Epstein, making him the opposing party's attorney.
Glassman's client is a witness/victim in the investigation into Maxwell, making him the opposing party's attorney.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Witness
events.description: A meeting scheduled for 11:00 a.m. at Robert Glassman's office between the federal prosecutors, Glassman, and his client (a witness/victim) to discuss the SDNY investigation.

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors from the SDNY were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell as of late 2019, planning in-person interviews with victims/witnesses.

Attorney Robert Glassman represented a key witness/victim, and prosecutors sought his permission to contact other individuals she identified, including her mother and contacts named Howie Simon, Dr. Cabe, and John Larkin.
The witness's mother was considered a potentially key witness but was believed to be living overseas, not in the United States.
The planned discussion topics for the witness interview included specifics on travel, steps for corroboration, and specific conduct by Epstein and/or Maxwell.
The email chain demonstrates the careful, attorney-mediated process prosecutors used to communicate with victims/witnesses in the high-profile case.
